**Request for Proposal (RFP)**
# High Risk Offender Accompaniment

## Responsiblity
The Correctional Service Canada, Pacific Region, is soliciting proposals from qualified vendors to provide transportation and accompaniment services for high-risk offenders released from institutions within the Pacific Region.

## Objective 
The objective of this RFP is to procure a service that ensures a seamless transition of in-custody offenders back to the community, with a specific emphasis on transportation to Community Residential Facilities (CRFs) or Community Corrections Centres (CCCs) within British Columbia.

## Statement of Work 
Transportation services will be provided for offenders from the institution where they are being released to any CRF or CCC site within British Columbia. The contractor must maintain accurate records of all accompaniments, provide a verbal report to the supervising Parole Officer on offender behavior and motivation, and submit collected data on a monthly basis.

## Evaluation Criteria 
Bids will be evaluated based on the lowest price of a compliant bid.

## Business Requirements

- **Vendor Business Requirement**: The vendor must be a registered business with a valid tax ID.
- **Vendor Licenses and Registration**: Vendor must obtain the necessary licenses and registrations to operate in British Columbia.
- **Indigenous Business Set-aside**: This project is not subject to a Indigenous Business Set Aside.

## Security Requirements

- **Security Level**: High-Risk Offender Accompaniment Services
- **Security Requirements**: The vendor must comply with all security requirements as outlined in the Contract.

## Contract
- **Duration**: September 1, 2023 to March 31, 2025, with a possible renewal for two additional one-year periods.
- **Contact Information**: Katie Simpson, Contracting Authority, (604) 870-2401, 801BidSubmissions@csc-scc.gc.ca.

## Conditions for Bid Submission 

- **Languages**: Documents may be submitted in either English or French.
- **Language of Submission**: Suppliers have the option to submit a single French or English bid or a bid with both French and English documents.

## Notice to Bidders 
- To access the complete bid solicitation package and evaluation criteria, please visit Canada Buys/Tenders Opportunities website. 
- Suppliers are required to register for a Canada Buys account prior to submitting a bid.
